Articles.Content: I was wondering, instead of having a bunch of different landing gear types, could someone make a mod that has procedural landing gear? would that be possible to make?
In stock there's only 3 types. What do you mean by procedural? Like it automatically chooses the appropriate leg based on size/weight? Not sure if that's possible due to animations.

In stock there's only 3 types. What do you mean by procedural? Like it automatically chooses the appropriate leg based on size/weight? Not sure if that's possible due to animations.

He said landing gear, not landing legs. I'm guessing He wants something with a variable height. It's very hard even with modded gear to get your plane to sit just right on the runway, have it lined up with the CoM, and still have the flexibility of trying various wing configurations (low, mid, high), while keeping the gear spaced far enough that it doesn't roll the plane on landing, and stable enough that it doesn't wheelbarrow on take off.

There are just so many landing gear concerns, having only 1 set of gear limits design immensely.

Edited September 23, 2014 by Alshain

Hi, sounds like a great idea, unfortunately if you have a look through the modding sections you will see a lot of very time consuming development being spent just to get 1 set of gear working never mind, multiple sets , there are some very neat things in the works but in reality due to the outright complexity and variations that are really needed I doubt it's even possible to make anything but a very simple gear part procedurally, I'm not even sure if procedural wheels are possible, they may be though, and that would need to be a first step on the way to a concept.

In short don't hold your breath

biggest thing is wheelcollider doesn't scale with the mesh. if tweakscale works the way I think it works, you'll have gear wheels that float or sink into the ground when you make the landing gear bigger and smaller.

Yeah, having only one landing gear option has been a pain. I would love to see some more variety and something dynamic would be awesome.

I stand corrected. I know using rescaleFactor to change a landing gear's size will make it work incorrectly. tweakScale obviously works in different fashion and is compatible with landing gears.
This might be a feature to add to tweakscale. (scaling landing gear strength with size)
